column4: quick question. I have set my ubuntu box to be static ip and now dns server is not working. Looking at /etc/resolv.conf it seems like things have changed quite a bit in the new version. Is there a good documentation on what I'm supposed to do to fix this?
resolv.conf works the same in 8.04 as it did in 6.06 and early
alright, then it doesn't work the way it does on gentoo I guess. There is a warning saying do not edit this by hand.
it works exactly the same was way as it does in gentoo
in where? I just want to add my nameserver to resolv.conf. I have static ip, so dhclient is not being called, but I don't want to edit /etc/resolv.conf if there is a better place to edit it.
you have to edit resolv.conf - thats what it's there for
you can put static info in there
as I said it works exactly the same in every other distro
so, I should just ignore the big warning in that file.
so yes, you can ignore that
although I'm concerned why you have that warning, I don't see it in an 8.04 box
